articles.headline: True-Crime Podcasts About Trump Are Everywhere
articles.snippet: MSNBC, NPR, Vox Media and The Atlanta Journal-Constitution are all aiming to capitalize on interest in the criminal cases against President Donald J. Trump with the shows.
articles.abstract: MSNBC, NPR, Vox Media and The Atlanta Journal-Constitution are all aiming to capitalize on interest in the criminal cases against President Donald J. Trump with the shows.
articles.lead_paragraph: True crime is among the most popular genres in podcasting. One of the biggest stories in the coming months is the wave of criminal charges facing former President Donald J. Trump.

articles.headline: ‘We Are Not Equipped to Deal With This’: Migrant Surge Overwhelms U.S. Border
articles.snippet: Officials are struggling to contend with the chaos at the U.S.-Mexico border as thousands of migrants arrive every day, trekking from the farthest reaches of the globe.
articles.abstract: Officials are struggling to contend with the chaos at the U.S.-Mexico border as thousands of migrants arrive every day, trekking from the farthest reaches of the globe.
articles.lead_paragraph: At a remote spot in the Arizona desert, near a hole in the border wall, dozens of migrants huddled over wood fires.

articles.headline: They’re Paid Billions to Root Out Child Labor in the U.S. Why Do They Fail?
articles.snippet: Private auditors have failed to detect migrant children working for U.S. suppliers of Oreos, Gerber baby snacks, McDonald’s milk and many other products.
articles.abstract: Private auditors have failed to detect migrant children working for U.S. suppliers of Oreos, Gerber baby snacks, McDonald’s milk and many other products.
articles.lead_paragraph: One morning in 2019, an auditor arrived at a meatpacking plant in rural Minnesota. He was there on behalf of the national drugstore chain Walgreens to ensure that the factory, which made the company’s house brand of beef jerky, was safe and free of labor abuses.

articles.headline: When Haley Dodged the Slavery Question, She Put Her Coalition at Risk
articles.snippet: Nikki Haley’s avoidance of mentioning slavery as a cause of the conflict, which she walked back on Thursday, threatened to dent her crossover appeal to independents and moderate Democrats.
articles.abstract: Nikki Haley’s avoidance of mentioning slavery as a cause of the conflict, which she walked back on Thursday, threatened to dent her crossover appeal to independents and moderate Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prominent Democratic donors, anxious about the increasingly authoritarian language of Donald J. Trump, have been calling on Democratic voters and independents to thwart the former president’s comeback by voting for Nikki Haley in open Republican primary elections.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Jazmine Ulloa
